docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: At a doctor's basement office in Washington Heights, a line of 50 people stretched up the stairs and out onto Broadway. Medicaid records indicate that the doctor spends an average of less than two minutes per patient, diagnosing nearly everybody as suffering from the same form of hypertension and needing a $45 prescription.
